text:
Oh YUM!  Loved them!  I fried them in small batches in my fry daddy, and kept the oven at 250 to keep the ones done warm.  Each batch of 8 wings took 10 minutes in the deep fryer.  When the 2nd to last batch was in the fryer, I made the sauce.  Used Franks Red Hot, although I think the next time I will use a little hotter sauce.  Breading was crunchy, and delicious.  I actually breaded the wings, and put them in the fridge for about 5 hours before frying them off.  Wonderful recipe.  Thank you!

text:
Great flavor!  I used chicken tenders rather than wings and baked for low fat.  Don't skip the refrigeration!  I sprayed my non-stick skillet with Pam and very lightly browned, then put in a 350 oven for about 15 minutes.  After backing returned to the skillet and poured the sauce all over it and stirred just to heat through.  Came out perfect and served with low fat bleu cheese salad dressing.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've made this twice in the last week. The first time I was impatient and only put the beaded wings in the fridge for 40 minutes. After reading the other reviews, I made sure to let them set the full 90 minutes, so that they could get sticky. They were awesome both times, but they were the best when I let them set the full 90. I used Frank's Original Red Hot Sauce and doubled the amount of cayenne pepper because we like them hot. I made a much bigger batch of the breaded wings the second time so I ended up testing out another sauce of 1/4 cup Bill Johnson's Hot & Spicy Barbeque sauce with 2 tbls. honey  for 6 wings and those were really good too.

I too do not possess a deep fryer so as others suggested, I baked.  However, I did pan fry the wings (I actually used drummettes) for about 15 minutes in olive oil, then battered them, refrig'd for about 90 mins, then baked for 45 @ 350, and finally added the sauce.  these babies were HOT!  They don't seem like it at first but it catches you by surprise!  anyway, 4 out of 5 because its not perfect, but  good!

text:
These are absolutely the best chicken wings I have ever had.  I don't even like chicken wings at restaurants.  I made these for Super Bowl party and then ended making them again the following weekend b/c they were so delicious.  Definitely let the wings set in the fridge to get sticky before cooking.  I baked @ 400 for 40 minutes, sprayed w/ cooking spray and then broiled for 5 min.  I used Texas Pete for the hot sauce.  I also made a mix of spicy bbq as another review suggested and it was delicious.  Great to have 2 wing flavors.  MAKE THESE WINGS you will not be disappointed!

text:
This recipe is amazing!  It looks complicated, but is really simple.  I followed Amydoll's suggestion for baking them instead of frying and I added a little chili powder to both trhe sauce and the breading, it worked beautifully!  I actually am a vegetarian so they were made for my husband and some friends and they were an instant hit!  Someone else had made wings for the party and people were coming up to me saying "I didn't want to say this in front of him, but your wings were much better than his."  I plan on using variations on the recipes for chicken thighs and drumsticks, and this is the only recipe I'll use for Buffalo Wings - which says a lot coming from a Buffalonian : )

text:
I added garlic powder, onion powder, and pepper to the flour and the sauce. I definitely let the floured wings sit in the fridge for at least 90 minutes. I accidentally fried a batch for longer than 15 minutes and they were pretty brown and crispy, but so delicious! I put the sauce on at the very last minute, right before serving. Served with cut up celery and carrots with ranch, blue cheese, and honey mustard dip. My fiance and I loved it! Thanks for the great recipe!

I bought a deep fryer at Kohls post Thanksgiving sale and needed something to test it out with.  This recipe was wonderful!  It was the first time I made "wings" and they turned out perfect!  I actually used chicken tenders and fried them for 8-10 minutes.  I served them with ranch dressing for dipping.  I'm going to try a different sauce to top them with next time since my boyfriend isn't crazy about hot sauce (although I loved the franks hot sauce mix).  Oh and I cooked the hot sauce and butter with a clove of garlic cut up since i didn't have any garlic seasoning.  It worked great! YUM

text:
I will definitly make this my new hot wing recipe. Everyone loved them. Even my kids, and they were pretty hot. My hubby said they made his lips tingle. It is the breading that makes these so good. I did not use the sauce here. I split the difference and got a bottle of Texas Pete's Buffalo Wing Sauce and Franks Buffalo Wing Sauce and then added about 4 Tablespoons of Franks Red Hot. You can definitly make these to your own preference. I made about 60 wings!
